feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 10:30AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues due to warmer temperatures. * WHERE...The northern Copper River Basin along the Gulkana River and along Lake Louise Road.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 10:27PM PDT until June 06 at 6:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest to north winds 20 to 35 mph with gusts of 40 to 55 mph expected. There will be a lull in the winds from mid morning Monday through mid afternoon Monday. * WHERE...Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range and Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Santa Barbara County Southwestern Coast; Santa Ynez Mountains Western Range

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 10:27PM PDT until June 07 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. There will be a lull in the winds from mid morning Monday through mid afternoon Monday. * WHERE...Ventura County Mountains and Los Angeles County Mountains. Strongest near the Interstate 5 corridor.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains; Ventura County Mountains

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 10:27PM PDT until June 07 at 8:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...North winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. There will be a lull in the winds from mid morning Monday through mid afternoon Monday. * WHERE...Santa Ynez Mountains Eastern Range. Strongest in the foothills above Santa Barbara to Montecito Hills.

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued June 05 at 5:12PM PDT until June 06 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Northwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph expected. * WHERE...Mojave Desert Slopes. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 7 AM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 12:36AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Custer, Blaine and southwestern Butte Counties through 200 AM MDT... At 1236 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northeast of Atlanta to 6 miles southwest of Fairfield. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail.

entry.summary: ...The Bitterroot River in Ravalli and Missoula counties and the Clark Fork River above Missoula in Missoula county are expected to rise to near minor flood stage... entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued June 05 at 2:34PM MDT by NWS

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 06 at 2:25AM CDT until June 06 at 3:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHERN CREEK...SOUTHERN PAWNEE AND SOUTHWESTERN TULSA COUNTIES WILL EXPIRE AT 230 AM CDT... The storms which prompted the warning have weakened below severe limits, and no longer pose an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds 45 to 55 mph are still possible with these thunderstorms.
